key_work.brief_description: In the 1980s, roles for Greek actors were limited, so they created their own - first the stage show Wogs out of Work (1987), and then the sitcom Acropolis Now, one of the first TV shows to bring much-needed diversity to Australian screens.

end.title: MasterChef Australia
end.brief_description: MasterChef Australia is a Logie Award-winning Australian competitive cooking game show based on the original British MasterChef. It is produced by Shine Australia and screens on Network Ten. Restaurateur and chef Gary Mehigan, chef George Calombaris and food critic Matt Preston serve as the show’s main judges. Journalist Sarah Wilson hosted the first series, however her role was dropped at the end of the series.

constellations_other.name: Culture, food and family
constellations_other.description: Food as a link to culture and family.

links.description: This sitcom used food, family and traditions to call out existing racial stereotypes and redefine who we saw on Australian tv and how we related to them. Reality cooking shows like MasterChef reflect the diversity of Australian society with their contestant’s families and traditions celebrated in their food.
